title: (x) Registration - FF Dax {Mike Y, Addison Hall}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141852im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23251.gif)   
   
   
I'm trying to identify the font on the top. The one on the bottom is clearface. They definately have similar characteristics, but the stems are missing and some of the accents are different. Any Ideas?
author: jmgd

comments.content:
If I may be more precise, the one on the bottom is Clearface Gothic. This reminded me of a recent fascinating [thread involving Phil Martin's Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141852/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/21890.html), which was a Clearface Gothic spinoff/enhancement, but I don't think it's the answer to this post.   
   
After consulting with the Sans Serif ID Guide I came up with [FF Dax](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141852/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&packagefontid=0&displayfontid=FF.10269.4.13&view=single&searchID=0&searchby=keyword&searchletter=A&searchstr=Dax&totalrecords=105&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1), which I think is your mystery font.

Try FF Dax   
   
 ![FF Dax Sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141852im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23259.gif)   
   
Here's the link: [FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141852/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdisplay&displayfontid=FF.10269.0.0&packagefontid=0&view=package&searchID=0&searchby=keyword&searchletter=A&searchstr=dax&totalrecords=105&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1)   
   
-Addison
Thanks. This one was driving me crazy.
